document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomic study of the genus Hypatopa Walsingham, 1907 (Lepidoptera: Blastobasidae) in China, with descriptions of five new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taxonomic study of the genus Hypatopa Walsingham, 1907 (Lepidoptera: Blastobasidae) in China, with descriptions of five new species

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Hypatopa moriutiella
Sinev, 1986 : 62
. Type locality: Russia ( Primorskiy Territory).

, holotype, ♂. (Scale bars = 2 mm)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis . Forewing length 8.0– 9.5 mm ( Fig. 3 ).
Hypatopa moriutiella
is similar to
H. plebis Adamski, 2013
; the female genitalia of the two share an elongate tubular corpus bursae that lacks a signum.
Hypatopa moriutiella
can be separated from the latter by the ill-defined juxta, the phallus spherically dilated basally, the internal sclerite of the phallus curved in the distal 1/ 3 in the male genitalia ( Fig. 11 ), and the eighth tergum with a darkly pigmented longitudinal median streak in the female genitalia ( Fig. 19 ). In
H. plebis
, the juxta is well sclerotized, the phallus is not dilated basally, the internal sclerite of the phallus is broadly curved in the middle in the male genitalia, and the longitudinal median streak in the eighth tergum is absent in the female.
Hypatopa moriutiella
is also similar to
H. silvestrella
Kuznetzov, 1984
in the male genitalia, and the differences between them are given in the diagnosis of
H. silvestrella
.
Distribution . China ( Beijing , Gansu , Hebei , Heilongjiang , Henan , Inner Mongolia , Liaoning , Ningxia , Qing- hai, Shanxi , Sichuan , Tianjin ), Russian Far East (Primorskiy Territory).
Note . This species is recorded for the first time in China .
